comment: Ever wonder how Family Physician fees in Alberta compare to other provinces ? These are the top four billing codes for Family Physicians . ( They account for % of all FP billing in Alberta . ) <URL>
amr:
# ::snt Ever wonder how Family Physician fees in Alberta compare to other provinces ? These are the top four billing codes for Family Physicians . ( They account for % of all FP billing in Alberta . ) <URL>
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (w / wonder-01
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (t / thing
                  :manner-of (c / compare-01
                        :ARG1 (f / fee
                              :mod (p / person
                                    :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                                          :ARG2 (p2 / physician
                                                :mod (f2 / family))))
                              :location (p3 / province
                                    :name (n / name
                                          :op1 "Alberta")))
                        :ARG2 (f3 / fee
                              :mod p
                              :location (p4 / province
                                    :mod (o / other)))))
            :time (e / ever))
      :snt2 (c2 / code
            :quant 4
            :mod (t2 / top)
            :mod (b / bill-01)
            :beneficiary p
            :domain (t3 / this))
      :snt3 (a / account-01
            :ARG0 (t4 / they)
            :ARG1 (p5 / percentage
                  :ARG3-of (ii / include-91

                              :location p3)))))

comment: On top of these , AB also pays $ per visit for Business Costs as well as Complex Modifiers . ( CMs are not paid in any other province . ) Compare to the rates other provinces pay . Except for the psych visit in SK , our rates are higher than these provinces . Even without a $ CM
amr:

(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (p / pay-01
                  :ARG0 (s / state
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "AB"))
                  :ARG3 (m2 / monetary-quantity

                        :ARG1 (t / this)))
            :op2 (p2 / pay-01

                  :ARG0 (p3 / province
                        :mod (a4 / any)
                        :mod (o / other))
                  :ARG3 (m3 / modulate-01
                        :mod (c2 / complex))))
      :snt2 (c3 / compare-01
            :ARG1 (r / rate
                  :ARG1-of (p4 / pay-01

            :ARG3 (m4 / more)

                        :unit (d / dollar)

            :mod (e2 / even)))
